concept.title: Localization-friendly images
concept.shortdesc: Learn a few tips to make your images easier to localize.

section.title: Image format
section.p: If your images contain text that you want to translate, avoid using bitmaps, such as JPG or PNG files. Use files instead. Most tools can translate text contained in SVG files.

section.title: Callouts
section.p: To simplify the localization process, avoid using descriptions within images. Instead, use numbered callouts and explain them under the image.

image.alt: A DITA <fig> element containing an image with two callouts that are explained in a numbered list below the image

section.title: UI screens
section.p: If your documentation contains UI screens, it's important to consider whether the UI text has been localized. You may need to plan the additional step of capturing UI screens in each target language.
